name: Mantra PortSea

reviews.title: Great Holiday
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our 3 year wedding anniversary in March 2005. The place was great, it was a short walk (10 minutes) from Port Douglas . The room was nice with a spa tub and a pretty good kitchen, we BBQ'd and cooked for 3 out of our 6 nights and saved a bit of money. The Lagoon style pool was very cool. There was no room service or cleaning up, but we preferred not having anyone in our room. Overall it was much better than we expected!

reviews.title: Comfortable and clean
reviews.text: The Portsea Resort was a very nice place to stay. There were many nice people on staff who were actually glad to help. The breakfasts were very good and there were many selections to choose from. The pool bar left a little to be desired as their prices emptied your pocket with one drink. The rooms were very clean and well kept. The showers were amazing! You'll really love the bathrooms! The work out facility would be my only true complaint. They had around 5 or 6 different machines...one of which was in operation and it wasn't working entirely properly. Once they get some new equipment in there, the PortSea Resort will be a fabulous get-away for anyone!

I don't see how there can be any bad reviews for this resort! My fiance and I stayed there for 3 nights in August of 2005. We did not notice any mold anywhere, save for a couple of spots in the far corners of the blinds (this is a tropical area, and it is to be expected!) Check in was a breeze and the front desk staff were extremely helpful. The mini-restaurant at the pool bar was very handy if we didn't feel like walking into town for dinner. The food was great too, and very affordable.
reviews.title: FABULOUS!! No complaints here...

reviews.text: And if the carpets weren't cleaned during a stay, it's because your stay was less than 8 days. The information sheet given on check in states that rooms are only cleaned if your stay is 8 days or longer. This is an apartment style resort, not a typical hotel. It's a great place to stay if you just want your own space and want to feel like it's your own place.
reviews.title: Breakout of the Breakfree Besort
Fabulous*Fantastic*Perfect
reviews.text: Bed bugs are an unfortunate but somewhat common occurance in hotels (they're even in your own bed at home!). Bed bugs can invade the dingiest motel to a 5-star resort. Having studied the hotel industry and worked in it, I have heard of a world-class 5 star hotel chain that had to shut down 2 entire floors of its hotel in order to get rid of the bed bugs. But we did not find a single bed bug in our room!

reviews.title: Beware of bed Bugs at the Port Sea Resort
reviews.text: The tropical buffet breakfast in the mornings was fantastic, and the staff were always quick to clear our tables. The proximity to the beach was great, and the walk into town was good to burn off a few calories after a delicious pizza from the pizza joint across the street. The lap pool looked neat, although we didn't try it. The barbeque areas were also handy if you were staying a long length of time. All in all, if you want a relaxing, comfortable and memorable experience in Port Douglas, we would recommend the Portsea.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Having booked at the last minute for three nights for what appeared to a reasonable deal, on the internet , for a four star hotel, I was disappointed and disgusted when we reached our room. We past a tidy reception area and the room did not reflect this.It was dirty, dusty and smelled of damp and was fusty . Our request to have the room cleaned was followed by a change of room to one that was worse, if anything. The cane furniture was ingrained with dirt and dead bugs were left behind the headboard for three days along with a spoon that fell from behind the headboard. We did not unpack our clothes for the whole stay.The carpets were stained and had not been cleaned once during our stay.Shabby and grubby describes the bedding and fittings. A two star is the true rating for the rooms. Shame they do not reflect the design and setting of this resort which had a lot to offer.Anne Arundale York u.k...

This resort, from the moment you walk in, past the beautiful entry, to the moment you leave, is a special, romantic, secluded, friendly, relaxed place to be. We stayed for 5 nights, and couldv'e easily stayed for longer. The atmosphere during the day, the pool, the food, the bar, the surrounds are all gorgeous. Even the smallest rooms are so spacious. The fact that they are apartments means NO annoying roomservice, which was great. The night surroundings are peaceful, and earthy. Get breakfast every morning, they put out a great spread. Would, will and ARE going to go back to THIS resort ONLY whenever i go back to Port. There is NO point trying anywhere else. Loved it!
reviews.title: Go There Now!!!
Enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: We were here for 4 nights in mid November. Our apartment overlooked the pool and was on the top floor. It wasn't particularly easy to find your way around the maze of corridors but we got there eventually. The room was very spacious and it was great having a nice little balcony to sit out on. Everything was pretty modern in the room and there was no sign of mould anywhere! We were in the dry season I guess.

There is also a hotel laundromat which sometimes was hard to find a free machine but it certainly made life a lot easier. We didn't bother with the dryer adn just hung it overnight on the balcony using their clothes horses. The clothes were pretty dry by the next morning.
reviews.title: Brilliant - 10 out of 10

description: Mantra Portsea Resort is a short walk to golden beaches and Port Douglas’ main tourist strip on Macrossan Street. The resort offers hotel rooms, one and two bedroom studio apartments. Facilities include three swimming pools, a waterslide, spas and waterfalls linked by a central lagoon with a swim-up pool bar serving drinks and light snacks, exercise room, tennis court, 24 hour reception, barbecue facilities, breakfast room, guest laundry, internet room, PortSea massage room (by appointment), undercover parking.
